p: Introduction.

ph.#tail: results appear in a series of graphs and charts, which provide a visual representation of your search results.

p: The left side of the report page shows how many cases your search found and provides some tools you can use to narrow your results.
We'll take a closer look at those tools later in this demo.
Chart and Graph Tabs.
Besides displaying results in a variety of graphs, you can display individual cases that may be of particular interest or relevance.
Click the right or left arrow to show more titles.
You can select a title to display it in full view below the tabs.
Cite List.
The report also includes a cite list, which you can use to view individual cases.
You can sort the cases a number of ways using the Sort by menu.
Or you can select the column headers to sort the documents.
Click a document title to see the full text. The document is opened in its own tab.
Return to your results by selecting either the Report tab or the document tab’s Close icon.
"At a Glance" View.
"At a Glance" shows thumbnail views of each graph. Click any of them to see it in full view.
"Cases/Year by Resolution" Graph.
The "Number of Cases Per Year by Resolution" graph shows, by year, how the cases that match your search were resolved.
It can indicate trends or spikes that might warrant further exploration.
Rest your mouse over a bar to display information about the verdict or settlement.
Note that you can see more information this way on all of the graphs.
"Award by Resolution" Chart.
This chart shows the average and median award amount for each resolution type, based on your search criteria.
Types of resolutions may include plaintiff and defendant verdicts, settlements, and unknown verdicts.

"Cases/Year" Graph.
The "Cases per Year" graph shows the number of cases per year that match your search criteria.
This graph could also indicate trends or spikes that might be worth further exploration.
"Percent Cases by Resolution" Chart.
The "Percentage of Cases by Resolution" chart groups your matched cases based on how they were resolved.
Filtering Results.
Tools for narrowing your results are located in the left pane.
You can enter additional terms in the "Search within results" box to include only results with those terms.
Or, you can filter your search results based on:
Court,
Practice areas and topics,
Case resolution,
Timeline,
Award amount,
Injuries,
Known data.
To display more options in a category, select its More link.
To select more than 1 category for a filter, choose "Select multiple". Select checkboxes for the categories you want, then select the OK button.
Use the Timeline to limit results to a date range. You can use the sliders to set the start and end dates, or type them in the date boxes. Then select the OK button to view the results.

As you add filters, the "Narrow By" pane shows which filters you've selected. You can remove a filter by selecting its Remove icon. You can select the "Clear all" link to remove all filters and return to your original results list.
To return to the main search page, select the logo in the upper left corner of the screen.
